property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: An accessor for a camera on the local host. This can be a built-in camera or a USB-connected camera. This accessor has two modes of operation, "triggered" and "open loop." In triggered mode, it captures an image whenever a trigger input is received and produces that image on its output. In open-loop mode, it captures every image produced by the camera, at the speed of the camera, and produces on the output a stream of such images. It limits the number of outputs to maxFrameRate images per second, even if the camera produces more images than that. You can use the maxFrameRate parameter to avoid overwhelming your application.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee (eal@eecs.berkeley.edu)

property.name: trigger (port)
property.value: A trigger input for triggered mode. The value is ignored and can be anything.

property.name: image (port)
property.value: A stream of captured images.

property.name: triggered (parameter)
property.value: If true, use triggered mode. Otherwise, use open-loop mode. This is a boolean that defaults to false.

property.name: camera (parameter)
property.value: The name of the camera to use. A list of available cameras is presented as options. This is a string that defaults to "default camera", which uses the system default, if there is one.

property.name: viewSize (parameter)
property.value: The view size to use for capture, in pixels. A list of available view sizes for the selected camara is presented as options. This is a JSON specification with a "width" and "height" field, as in for example {"width":640, "height":480}.

property.name: maxFrameRate (parameter)
property.value: If not triggered, this limits the output to the specified number of frames per second. This is a number that defaults to 25.

property.name: camera
property.value: default camera

property.name: viewSize
property.value: {"width":176, "height":144}

property.name: description
property.value: Accessor that stops execution of the enclosing swarmlet when it receives an input with value true. It does this by identifying the top-level enclosing composite accessor and invoking wrapup on it.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee (eal@eecs.berkeley.edu)

property.name: stop (port)
property.value: A signal with value true to stop the swarmlet.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Compare the input with a known good input. If you set ''trainingMode'' to true and provide inputs, then the inputs will be recorded in the ''correctValues'' parameters. Otherwise, the inputs will be compared against those in the ''correctValue'' parameter.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks based on the Ptolemy NonStrictTest actor by Paul Whitaker, Christopher Hylands, Edward A. Lee

property.name: input (port)
property.value: The input value.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: False as long as there is data to compare against the input

property.name: correctValues
property.value: {"{type=\"class ptolemy.data.AWTImageToken\", width=\"176\", height=\"144\"}"}
